intro: Foenum-graecum officinale var. tibetanum, commonly known as Tibetan fennel, is a herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic seeds and foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and feathery leaves. Its seeds are small, yellowish-brown, and have a distinctive anise-like scent. It is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
